meanings.definition: To put or set in an inappropriate or incorrect place.
meanings.sent1: I keep misplacing my keys and then spend hours searching for them.
meanings.sent2: She often misplaces her glasses and has to ask for help finding them.
meanings.sent3: I misplacing my phone in the fridge this morning, silly me!
meanings.sent4: Her absent-mindedness led to misplacing important documents in the chaos of her desk.
meanings.sent5: The magician performed a trick where he seemed to be misplacing objects at will.

meanings.sent1: He tends to misplace his wallet when he's in a rush.
meanings.sent2: I always misplace my pen and end up borrowing one from a colleague.
meanings.sent3: I misplacing my homework right before class was a disaster!
meanings.sent4: The detective suspected foul play when the evidence seemed to be misplaced at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The misplacing of the treasure map added an unexpected twist to the adventure story.
